intro: Tithymalus djimilensis, commonly known as the Djimilensis tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
